intro: Ophiuros subulatus, commonly known as the slender sea star, is a marine invertebrate belonging to the class Asteroidea. It is characterized by its elongated, tapering body and numerous slender arms, which can number up to 20 or more. This species is typically found in shallow coastal waters, where it thrives on rocky substrates and sandy bottoms. Its body is covered in a calcareous skeleton, providing structural support and protection. Ophiuros subulatus plays a role in marine ecosystems by scavenging on the seafloor and contributing to nutrient cycling.
